wikipedia_page.main: Mike Brogan was a pseudonym used by successful children's comic strip author Fred Baker  (d.2008). He wrote 10 novels between 1977 and 1979 published in the UK by Corgi Carousel (Originally by Aiden Ellis Publishing Ltd) featuring Action Man and his American friend G.I. Joe. Illustrations were by Mike Codd.

response: Other related items were also produced; in the 1960s–70s there were companion leaflets for various sets that provided background information on the actual activity/military division, etc.; In 1977 six novels were published under the pseudonym Mike Brogan, and into the 1980s, Action Man annuals were released.
